intro: Rourea breviracemosa, commonly known as the short raceme rourea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its dense, clustered inflorescences and small, yellowish-green flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Rourea breviracemosa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral structure.
